Pokaži črni kiti dve, dva lepa bela cuzika
Jezikoslovec Karel Štrekelj je zbiral in objavljal narodne pesmi. Ker je upošteval tudi bolj kosmate, je bil na udaru duhovščine.
01 Nov 2019, 17:48 by Iztok Ilich



Karel Štrekelj



Rojstna hiša na Gorjanskem FOTO: Iztok Ilich



Spomenik pred rojstno hišo FOTO: Iztok Ilich



Spominska plošča FOTO: Iztok Ilich



Prvi snopič Slovenskih narodnih pesmi



Slovenske narodne pesmi vezane v dveh knjigah



Pesmi so bile zbrane iz vseh slovenskih pokrajin.



Ena od številnih različic


GORJANSKO – Delo pred 160 leti rojenega Karla Štreklja, Kraševca z Gorjanskega pri Komnu, že dolgo ne vznemirja nikogar več. Današnji mediji so prepolni še bolj kosmatih in opolzkih izrazov in rim od verzov, objavljenih v zbirki Slovenske narodne pesmi, ki so pred dobrim stoletjem vzbujali silovito ogorčenje in zavračanje večine slovenske duhovščine in laikov iz njenega kroga.


Slovenske narodne pesmi vezane v dveh knjigah

Rojstna hiša še stoji na jugozahodnem robu vasi, kjer se razideta cesti proti mejnemu prehodu Gorjansko in – ob največjem vojaškem pokopališču na Krasu – proti Brestovici. Domačija, ena večjih v kraju, pritegne pozornost tudi s spomenikom na zahodni strani ter spominsko ploščo na pročelju. Na njej piše, da je bil univ. prof. dr. Karel Štrekelj jezikoslovec, narodopisec, organizator in urednik. Zadnji podatek omenja znanstvenikovo življenjsko delo, ki je s skoraj 9000 objavljenimi enotami dosežek, s kakršnim se ne morejo pohvaliti niti mnogi večji evropski narodi.Za tako pomembnim delom je kajpada tudi velika zgodba.Objavljanje Slovenskih narodnih pesmi, enega temeljev slovenske kulturne dediščine, je trajalo 28 let. Zbiranje pred tem še skoraj desetletje zraven. Urednik objave zadnjih snopičev, ki jih je v glavnem še pripravil, ni več dočakal. Za vodenico, kot so včasih rekli skrajni obliki srčnega popuščanja, je, tako kot France Prešeren, umrl junija 1912 v Gradcu, kjer je bil profesor na univerzi.Zbiranja in preučevanja narodnega blaga te vrste se je Štrekelj lotil že med študijem. Uspelo mu je dobiti rokopisno gradivo iz več zasebnih zapuščin, še več zapisov pesmi in sorodnega gradiva pa je pridobil od rodoljubov iz vseh s Slovenci poseljenih habsburških dežel, potem ko je leta 1887 objavil Prošnjo za narodno blago z napotki za zbiranje.


Prvi snopič Slovenskih narodnih pesmi

Zaradi nepričakovane obsežnosti gradiva, ki so mu ga pošiljali duhovniki, učitelji, študentje in drugi, je moral prilagajati svoje načrte. Ko je imel pred očmi zbirko s približno 800 stranmi, je bil že odločen, da pri merilih za objavo ne bo popuščal. »Kar se tiče ljubezenskih pesmi,« je zapisal, »se ne mislim v ničemer vdati 'gospodnuncem' (duhovščini), da brezmiselnim, nepoetičnim, umazanim ali 'klamfarskim' ne bo prostora, se pa razume samo ob sebi.« Enako pomembna je bila odločitev, da pesmi ne misli popravljati, »ker je tako delo jako problematične vrednosti in proti vsej kritiki. Obdrže naj lice in obliko, v kateri jih je zajel prvi zapisovavec iz vedno tekočega in izpreminjajočega se potoka narodnega duševnega delovanja.«Štrekelj je razmišljal o objavi zbirke pri Slovenski matici, vendar mu njen urednik Fran Levec sprva ni dajal upanja. Toda kar se je leta 1887 zdelo nemogoče, se je šest let pozneje vendarle zgodilo. Po smrti predsednika Matice, staroslovenskega veljaka kanonika Josipa Marna, je vodenje društva prevzel prav Levec, ki se je zavedal pomena Štrekljevega monumentalnega dela. Že leta 1893 je dosegel, da so zbirko sprejeli v program izdaj za naslednje leto, oddana pa je bila leto pozneje.


Spominska plošča FOTO: Iztok Ilich

Štreklju je pisal, da mu rokopis »jako ugaja«, drugi ocenjevalci pa tudi niso imeli večjih zadržkov. Očitki na račun nekaj »kosmatih« pesmi so po objavi prvega snopiča v okviru redne Matičine zbirke za leto 1895 prišli največ iz duhovniških vrst. Med najbolj sporna, za javnost pohujšljiva sta bila na primer verza: »Pokaži črni kiti dve, dva lepa bela cuzika …« 
Izločil robate in kosmate
Drugi snopič so dušebrižniki pričakali bolje pripravljeni: izšel je 1896., šele po tem, ko je Štrekelj iz rokopisa izločil 15 podobno pohujšljivih pesmi. Shranil jih je v poseben sveženj Robate in kosmate z mislijo, da jih »enkrat izda brez javnosti«. V naslednjih dveh letih sta sledila tretji in četrti snopič ter zaokrožila vsebino prve knjige Štrekljeve zbirke.Objave posameznih snopičev, kot je bila takrat navada, so zbiralce z vseh strani spodbujale, da so še naprej pošiljali gradivo. Burile pa so tudi duhove med Matičinimi odborniki. Ne nepričakovano, saj je v nadaljevanju šlo za »zaljubljene pesmi«, ki se, kot je pojasnil Štrekelj, »nanašajo na razmerje med moškim in ženskim spolom /…/ po stopinjah, kakor se ljubezensko razmerje želi, začenja, nadaljuje, goji, vživa in naposled neha ali z zakonom ali drugači, veselo ali žalostno.«


Rojstna hiša na Gorjanskem FOTO: Iztok Ilich

Kritike iz konservativnega tabora je še vedno motila – po njihovem – za mladino kvarna vsebina, pridružili pa so se jim še nekateri liberalci. Nasprotovanje se je posebno zaostrilo leta 1902 ob predloženem gradivu za sedmi snopič. Z ugotovitvami, po Levčevem poročanju Štreklju v Gradec, da je zbirka »neestetična in svinjska« in da internacionalne kvante »nimajo nobene specifično slovenskonarodne vrednosti«.Štrekelj kritikom ni ostal dolžan. »Kakor mora botanik preučevati lepe in grde cvetlice, bodeči trn in strupeno gobo,« je zapisal v predgovoru, »tako mora tudi folklorist z isto ljubeznijo ravnati z narodnimi proizvodi, če tudi morda skleplje ali lomi tako zvani 'estetik' roke nad to predrznostjo ...«Poznejši snopiči – do 14., natisnjenega leta 1912 – so le še tu in tam dvignili nekaj prahu, vedno več pa je bilo pohval in priznanj – seveda največ od tujih strokovnjakov. Naslednjega 15. zvezka pa Karel Štrekelj ni več dočakal. Delal je do zadnjega, a ga je smrt prehitela, starega komaj 53 let. Nekdanji spori so bili pozabljeni in pokojniku so se spoštljivo poklonili pripadniki obeh taborov.
1859.leta se je rodil kraševski jezikoslovec.
Štrekljev projekt je dokončal jezikoslovec Joža Glonar. Tako je bil 15. snopič objavljen leta 1913, 16. z njegovimi komentarji pa je predvsem zaradi prve svetovne vojne izšel šele leta 1923.Podobo Karla Štreklja, znanstvenika evropskega kova, je ob stoti obletnici njegove smrti še dopolnila kritična objava dotlej neobjavljenih rokopisov njegovih predavanj o slovenski literaturi, ki jih je imel okrog leta 1900 na graški univerzi. To so bila prva univerzitetna predavanja o slovenski literaturi v slovenskem jeziku!

GORJANSKO - The work of Karl Štrekelj born 160 years ago, Kraševac from Gorjansko near Komen, has long bothered no one. Today's media are full of even more hairy and obscene expressions and rhymes than verses published in the collection of Slovene National Poems, which aroused a strong indignation and rejection of the majority of Slovene clergy and lay people from its circle a century ago.


Slovene national songs bound in two books

The birthplace still stands on the southwestern edge of the village, where the roads to the Gorjansko border crossing point and - along the largest military cemetery in the Karst - to Brestovica are revealed. The homestead, one of the largest in the town, also attracts attention with a monument on the west side and a memorial plaque on the facade. It says that he was a uni. prof. dr. Karel Štrekelj is a linguist, writer, organizer and editor. The last item mentions the scientist's life work, which with almost 9000 published units is an achievement that cannot be boasted by many major European nations. For such important works, it is also a great story. The publication of Slovene national songs, one of the foundations of Slovenian cultural heritage, is lasted 28 years. Collecting before that for almost a decade. The editor of the latest bundles, which he has mostly prepared, has not been welcomed. For France, as sometimes called extreme form of heart failure, he died, just like France Prešeren, in Graz in June 1912, where he was a professor at a university. Strekelj began collecting and studying national goods of this kind during his studies. He managed to obtain handwritten material from several private legacies, and obtained more poems and related material from patriots from all Habsburg lands inhabited by Slovenes, after publishing a Request for National Goods in 1887 with directions for collection.


The first bundle of Slovenian folk songs

Due to the unexpected abundance of material sent to him by priests, teachers, students and others, he had to adjust his plans. When he had a collection of about 800 pages before his eyes, he was already determined not to yield to the criteria for publication. "As far as love songs are concerned," he wrote, "I do not mean to give in to the 'gentlemen' (clergy), that there will be no place for the senseless, the un-poetic, the dirty, or the 'clamphard', but it goes without saying." it was a decision not to think of correcting the poem "because such work is of considerable problematic value and against all criticism. He should retain the face and shape in which they were first recorded by the ever-flowing and ever-changing stream of national mental activity. ”Štrekelj considered publishing the collection at Slovenska matica, but initially its editor Fran Levec gave him no hope. But what seemed impossible in 1887 happened six years later. After the death of President Matica, an old-time valid of the canonical Joseph Marne, Levec took over the management of the society, who was aware of the significance of Štrekl's monumental work. As early as 1893, he achieved acceptance of the collection into the program of editions for the following year, and was submitted a year later.


Memorial plaque PHOTO: Ilich Exit

Streklju wrote that the manuscript was "very pleasing" to him, and other reviewers also had no major reservations. The allegations of some "hairy" poems, after the publication of the first bundle, came mostly from the priestly ranks as part of the regular Mother's Collection for 1895. For example, one of the most controversial and poignant releases was the verse: "Show two black whales, two beautiful white whales ..."
Cut out robes and hairs
The second bundle was expected to be better prepared by the soulmakers: it came out in 1896, only after Strekelj had eliminated 15 similarly poignant poems from the manuscript. He stored them in a special Robate bundle, and he is furious with the thought of "releasing them once without publicity." For the next two years, the third and fourth bundles followed, rounding up the contents of the first book of the Štrekl Collection. The announcements of individual bundles, as was the custom at the time, encouraged collectors from all sides to continue submitting material. There were also spirits among Mother's councilors. Not unexpected, because the following were "love songs" which, as explained by Štrekelj, "refer to the relationship between the male and the female / ... / in degrees, as the love relationship wants, starts, continues, cultivates, enjoys and eventually cease, either by law or otherwise, joyful or sad. "


Birthplace in Gorjansko PHOTO: Ilich Island

Critics from the Conservative camp were still disturbed - in their view - by content that was corrupt, and joined by some liberals. Opposition was particularly aggravated in 1902 with the material submitted for the seventh bundle. According to the findings, according to Levc's report to Štrekelj in Graz, the collection is "aesthetically pleasing and pig-like" and that the international quanta "have no specific Slovene-national value". "Just as a botanist must study beautiful and ugly flowers, barbed thorns and poisonous mushrooms," he wrote in the preface, "so too must a folklorist treat national products with the same love, if he may also clasp or break his so-called 'aesthetic' hands over this insolence. ... ”Later bundles - until the 14th, printed in 1912 - only raised some dust here and there, and there was increasing praise and recognition - of course, most from foreign experts. However, Karel Štrekelj did not wait for the next volume 15. He worked until the last, but was overtaken by death, barely 53 years old. Former disputes have been forgotten and members of both camps have paid their respects to the deceased.
In 1859, a linguist from Karst was born.
The project was completed by linguist Joža Glonar. Thus, the 15th bundle was published in 1913, and its 16th commentary was published only in 1923, mainly because of the First World War. The image of Karl Štrekelj, a scientist of European blacksmithing, was supplemented by the critical publication of previously unpublished manuscripts of his lectures. about Slovene literature he had at the University of Graz around 1900. These were the first university lectures on Slovene literature in the Slovene language!
